item.title: Retiring Kafka Web Console
item.description: I’ve been a busy bee the past few months. The lack of activity on my blog and GitHub is a testament to this. Given my current priorities, I’ve taken the decision to retire Kafka Web Console. Don’t despair yourself! Kafka Manager appears to be a more sophisticated alternative to what I’ve developed, and besides, it’s maintained by Yahoo.

item.title: Apache Kafka for Event Sourcing
item.description: Event Sourcing is a pattern intended for "capturing all changes to an application state as a sequence of events". As explained by Fowler, the pattern is useful when you want the ability to completely rebuild the application state, perform temporal querying, or replay events. The LMAX platform is a famous example where Event Sourcing is applied to keep all application state in-memory and consequently contributing to the system's surprisingly high throughput and low latency.
